page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT NASH AREA
page.content: Although predominantly a farming region less people are now employed on the land due to mechanisation. Most people are employed in a variety of jobs ranging from manual workers to a high percentage of business / professional people. Those working in the villages are self_employed _ farmers, tradespeople or those running small businesses, others are domestic or farm workers. A large number are employed in nearby towns, the new city of Milton Keynes has attracted many families to the area. Good rail links to London enable residents to commute while others drive 50 miles or more round the country; 3 young men are in the services. A sign of the times are the working wives and mothers (a day nursery has started at Grove Farm) and sadly some residents are unemployed.
